name: Vena Vitals
headline: A small sticker that monitors blood pressure continuously
description: Vena Vitals makes a small sticker that monitors blood pressure continuously. We've shown that it works in the operating room and is as accurate as the best tools doctors have today, at a fraction of the cost. We're a team of health tech scientists with multiple past startups and exits, and we've built products that have scaled to over 2M users.

founders.name: Ray Liu, Founder
founders.description:
- Two health tech exits (to Cigna & Vizient)
- 15+ years leadership at GE Healthcare, Siemens, & startups (Ediom, Socialwellth)
- Built multiple products/services from ground zero, some with 2M+ users
- Set up quality system for factory in China that passed FDA inspection 
- MBA, Harvard Business School
- MS Electrical Engineering, University of California at Berkeley 
- BS Electrical Engineering, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

founders.name: Michelle Khine, Founder
founders.description: Professor of Biomedical Engineering and Serial Entrepreneur

founders.name: Josh Kim, Founder
founders.description:
PhD - Materials Science and Engineering, University of California, Irvine
MS - Materials Science and Engineering, University of California, Irvine
BS - Chemistry, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign

generated_description:
**Vena Vitals** is a promising health tech startup founded in 2019 and based in the vibrant hub of Irvine, California. They’re part of the prestigious Y Combinator Batch S20, which speaks volumes about their potential and innovative edge.

At the core of Vena Vitals' mission is an ingenious solution: a small sticker that continuously monitors blood pressure. This tool isn't just a gimmick; it’s been demonstrated to work effectively in operating rooms, matching the accuracy of traditional, pricier medical devices, but at a much lower cost. This could be a game changer in how blood pressure is monitored, making it more accessible to everyone.

The team behind Vena Vitals comprises skilled health tech scientists with a track record of launching successful startups that have collectively scaled to over 2 million users. Simply put, they know what they're doing.

Currently, the company operates with a lean team of nine dedicated employees. They’re tagged across various sectors like hard-tech, nanosensors, health-tech, medical devices, and digital health, which gives a glimpse into the multi-faceted approach they are taking to revolutionize monitoring devices.

For those interested in learning more about their impactful work or possibly collaborating, you can explore further at [venavitals.com](http://venavitals.com).

In a world where health metrics dictate outcomes more than ever, Vena Vitals stands out as a beacon of practical, innovative technology. Keep an eye on them; they’re just getting started.
